title: More Major Scale Practice
summary: Solfege practice with the major scale.

title: BASICS: Sing the Major Scale
summary:
Today, let's return to our roots and sing major scales. It's good for your theory knowledge, good for your intonation, good for your soul.

summary: You heard me. Play sappy.

title: Three Out-of-Key Chords You NEED to Know
summary: Secondary Dominants. The hip, in way to play out of key without leaving the key. Listen for some practice at recognizing II7, III7, and VI7.

summary: Tune in for some exercises and discussion of the major and minor pentatonic scale

summary: Today, instead of exercises, Sam discusses Dominant Seven, Major Seven, Minor Seven, Half-Diminished Seven, Fully-Diminished Seven, and Minor-Major Seven Chords.

title: Training your ear from Start to Finish

title: You Can Outwork Talent ("And We All Grow Up" by Libby Clawson)
summary: Every Monday, Sam spews his opinions about playing music by ear. Today, learn why talent is useless and you can outwork anybody.

title: Why Solfege? ("In a Different Time" by Ben Day)
summary: Welcome to Episode 1! Every Monday is General Principles day, a day where Sam covers a different principle regarding Music Theory and Ear Training. Today he avidly defends his belief in the value of Solfege.
